resources.string: Get notifications if you were possibly exposed to someone with COVID-19.
To continue checking for possible exposure, turn on Bluetooth and device location setting
To continue checking for possible exposure, turn on Bluetooth.
To continue checking for possible exposure, turn on device location setting
Permissions needed to enable Exposure Notifications
Continuation of permissions needed to enable Exposure Notifications

Get notified if you've been near someone who reported having COVID-19. 

Your phone uses Bluetooth to securely collect and share random IDs with other phones that are nearby. 

The date, duration, and signal strength associated with a possible exposure will be used to determine whether you will be notified based on parameters set by your public health authority. 

You may receive a notification to share a diagnosis with your health authority if you get an SMS with your test result. %1$s
Share app usage & performance data with Google
To help maintain and improve the app, some limited de-identified data about app performance and usage is shared with Google. This data does not identify you. %1$s
Until Exposure Notifications is turned on, you won’t be notified of possible exposure to COVID-19
As Exposure Notifications checks for exposures, recent checks appear below.
Exposure reports are stored for 14 days from possible exposure date
To get notified of possible COVID-19 exposure, turn on Exposure Notifications. %1$s
Using this service helps you protect your community - even if you\'ve been vaccinated.
The best way you can help your community is to share your results as soon as possible. If you do close now without sharing, you can pick up where you left off if you change your mind later.
This one-time code is used to verify your test result.
Helps the health authority determine when you may have been infectious and notify the right people of possible exposure.
Have you traveled in the last 14 days\?
Thank you for sharing your COVID-19 result
Your COVID-19 test result wasn\'t shared. Please try again.
Can\’t share test results offline. Check your internet connection & try again.
Have you been vaccinated against Covid-19\?

You can help even more. Without sharing your identity, you can help %1$s better understand the spread of Covid-19 by sharing if you\'ve been vaccinated. %1$s receives this data in aggregate form to protect your privacy.
If you test positive for COVID-19, your health authority usually provides a verification code by phone or text so that you can share your results.
A verification code allows you to share your test results. Your code will be sent to the number you provide.
To prevent people from submitting more than one result, your phone number may be temporarily stored by your public health authority.
Test date should be within the past 14 days.
I have received a positive COVID-19 test in the past 14 days.
Enter the code sent to you by %1$s.
You have already reported a test result recently.
If you would like to report another test result, please contact %1$s.
Invalid code. Make sure you\'re using the same device to both request and enter your verification code.
Check your number and try again. %1$s
You\'ve made too many requests. Contact %1$s if you still need a code.

plurals.name: self_report_code_already_requested
plurals.item: You\'ve made too many requests. You can request another code in %1$d minutes.
You\'ve made too many requests. You can request another code in %1$d minute.
You\'ve made too many requests. You can request another code in %1$d minutes.

resources.string: Help notify others who may have been exposed
Notify other people if your result gets updated?

%1$s may send you a second code to confirm your test result. You can automatically update your COVID-19 status & share additional days of random IDs using this second code, which can help notify others about possible exposure. Your identity is not shared with other people.
%1$s just updated your exposure timeline and may have alerted others of possible exposure.
Help contain the spread of COVID-19. Share this app with your community and help them protect themselves better with possible exposure notifications.
Help fight the spread of COVID-19 in the community. Download the app here: %1$s

Turn on Exposure Notifications so that %1$s can notify you if you’ve been near someone who reported having COVID-19. 

Your phone uses Bluetooth to securely collect and share random IDs with other phones that are nearby. 

The date, duration, and signal strength associated with an exposure will be shared with the app.
You won\'t be notified if you\'re exposed to COVID-19
Share app usage & performance data with Google
To help maintain and improve the app, some limited, de-identified data about app performance and usage is shared with Google. This data does not identify you.
Turn on your device\'s location setting to get notified of possible exposure to COVID-19.
Turn on Bluetooth to get notified of possible exposure to COVID-19.
To get notified of possible exposure to COVID-19, turn on Bluetooth & your device\'s location setting.
Free up storage on your phone to get notified of possible exposure to COVID-19.
Exposure Notifications is no longer available in your region.
This device doesn\’t support Exposure Notifications. See %1$s.
You can use only one Exposure Notifications app on your device at a time.\n\nDo you want to switch to the %1$s app?
Exposure Notifications is no longer available. %1$s
Exposure Notifications isn\’t available on your work profile. Try again on your personal profile.
%1$s can notify you of potential exposure to COVID-19
Date should occur within last %1$s days of today\’s date
The verification code doesn’t match. Try again.
The verification code is out of date. Contact %1$s for a new one.
This verification code can\'t be used at this time.
Unable to share the test result. Try again later.
Code has already been used to share test result
Exposure Notifications requires the latest version of Google Play services.
To view this content, make sure you have a recent browser installed on your device.
Help your health authority understand the spread of COVID-19
Share Exposure Notifications analytics with your health authority

These analytics, such as the number of notifications in your region, help health authorities understand how COVID-19 spreads. They can’t be read by Google and are aggregated for your health authority so they can’t be linked to your phone. %1$s
These analytics can’t be read by Google and are aggregated for your health authority so they can’t be linked to your phone. %1$s
Thank you for helping to stop COVID-19.
When you share your result, you can also choose to share when your symptoms started. This information can help stop the spread of COVID-19 and save lives.
If you receive an SMS with your test result, you may get a notification asking you to share your diagnosis in exposure notifications. You can disable this any time in settings.
Share your test result to protect your community
Update to the latest version of Exposure Notifications to finish sharing your test results.
Something went wrong. Try again in a few hours.
Your Health Authority no longer supports Exposure Notifications
Exposure Notifications has been turned off
